page.title: 14The Airlie Drummer,Cortachy
page.content: The drummer of Airlie met his death when Airlie Castle was attacked by Argyll and his men in 1640. He failed in his task to give warning of the attack and was locked in the tower when the castle was set alight. As the castle burned, the beating of the drum eerily continued. It has been heard several times since then. In 1849 in Glen Isla, a guest of Lord Ogilvy heard its beat.The following day Lord Ogilvy's father,the Earl of Airlie died in London.It was heard in Scotland before the 8th Earl died in Denver,Colorado and it is said that Lady Airlie heard it repeatedly before her husband,the 9th Earl was killed fighting in the Boer War. Today the remains of the drum are at Cortachy Castle.American guests unfortunately removed the scorched skin to keep as a souvenir.
